author: Joshua Fluke
description:
CEOs on LinkedIn cannot stop leadershiping all over the place. Everything — football games, changing diapers, walking to the grocery store, even seeing a cow — somehow becomes a leadership lesson in their minds. In this video, we break down the most unhinged CEO posts turning completely normal life events into motivational speeches nobody asked for.

From executives claiming “true leadership” means staying at a football game in bad weather, to board members extracting wisdom from cows, to founders role-playing telling employees they’re bad at their jobs… it’s peak LinkedIn lunacy. And yes, someone even turned maternity leave into a KPI dashboard.

We’re roasting the metaphors, the buzzwords, the self-importance, and the endless need to turn daily life into “CEO wisdom.” If you’ve ever seen a LinkedIn post so out of touch it made you question reality, you’re in the right place.

How do you define leadership? Going to the store? Taking a walk? Crawling home for engagement? Let me know i
title: CEOS CANNOT STOP LEADERSHIPPING THEMSELVES!
